Lack of trained archaeologists, leading to inexperienced team members.
Difficulty in locating the precise location of the ancient artifacts or ruins.
Weather conditions, such as rain or extreme heat, which can damage or destroy the artifacts and make it difficult to work.
Disagreements or conflicts among team members, leading to delays and inefficiencies in the dig.
Competition from other archaeological teams or organizations for the same artifacts or ruins, leading to conflicts and disputes.
